scenarios.question: A stranger offers you candy and asks you to go with them. What do you do?

options.text: Say 'No, thank you' and walk away quickly
options.feedback: Great decision! Never go anywhere with strangers.

options.text: Take the candy and follow them
options.feedback: Always say no to strangers and tell a trusted adult.

scenarios.question: Someone you don't know well asks for your home address. What do you do?

options.text: Don't share it and tell a parent or teacher
options.feedback: Perfect! Personal information should stay private.

options.text: Tell them your address
options.feedback: Never share personal information with people you don't know well.

scenarios.question: You're home alone and someone knocks on the door. What should you do?

options.text: Don't open the door and call a parent
options.feedback: Smart choice! Safety first when you're home alone.

options.text: Open the door to see who it is
options.feedback: Never open the door when you're alone. Call a trusted adult.

scenarios.question: Someone online asks to meet you in person. What do you do?

options.text: Tell your parents immediately
options.feedback: Excellent! Always involve parents in online interactions.

options.text: Agree to meet them
options.feedback: Online friends should stay online. Always tell your parents.

scenarios.question: A friend wants you to keep a secret that makes you uncomfortable. What do you do?

options.text: Tell a trusted adult about it
options.feedback: Brave choice! Some secrets should never be kept.

options.text: Keep the secret no matter what
options.feedback: If a secret makes you uncomfortable, always tell a trusted adult.

scenarios.question: You get separated from your family in a crowded place. What should you do?

options.text: Stay where you are and ask a store employee for help
options.feedback: Perfect! Staying put and finding an employee is the safest choice.

options.text: Wander around looking for them
options.feedback: Stay in one place so your family can find you more easily.

scenarios.question: Someone touches you in a way that feels wrong. What do you do?

options.text: Say 'Stop!' loudly and tell a trusted adult immediately
options.feedback: You're absolutely right! Your body belongs to you.

options.text: Stay quiet and don't tell anyone
options.feedback: Always speak up and tell someone you trust. It's never your fault.

scenarios.question: An adult asks you to help find their lost pet in a secluded area. What do you do?

options.text: Politely decline and suggest they ask another adult
options.feedback: Smart thinking! Adults should ask other adults for help.

options.text: Go with them to help
options.feedback: Adults shouldn't ask children for help. This could be a trick.

scenarios.question: You see someone being bullied at school. What should you do?

options.text: Tell a teacher and offer support to the person being bullied
options.feedback: You're a true hero! Standing up for others takes courage.

options.text: Ignore it and walk away
options.feedback: Speaking up helps stop bullying and supports those who need it.

scenarios.question: Someone sends you inappropriate pictures online. What do you do?

options.text: Don't respond, block them, and tell your parents immediately
options.feedback: Perfect response! You handled this very maturely.

options.text: Keep it to yourself
options.feedback: Always tell a trusted adult about inappropriate online content.
